thread.title: Canterbury ready to defend girls 1A state soccer title
thread.title_full: Canterbury ready to defend girls 1A state soccer title

title: Canterbury ready to defend girls 1A state soccer title
text:
Canterbury ready to defend girls 1A state soccer title 
By Dean Pantazi - 21 Alive October 25, 2015 Updated Oct 25, 2015 at 9:20 PM EDT 
FORT WAYNE, Ind. (21 Alive) - Canterbury will start its preps Monday for its return trip to the state 1A girls soccer finals. 
The fourth ranked Lady Cavs won twice on Saturday at the Laville semi-state and the reward is a rematch with second ranked Evansville Mater Dei, who Canterbury beat 1-0 to win the state title last year. 
The game will be at 10:30 am Saturday at Carroll Stadium in Indianapolis. 
And Canterbury coach Jennie Crandal sees no reason why her girls can't win it all again.
